questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your father asking permission to join your schoolmates who are going on an excursion.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in a local newspaper on the topic: Every school should have a library.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a short story illustrating the saying: All that glitters is not gold.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your District Director of Education giving at least, two reasons why caning should be banned in schools.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story which ends with the expression: '................ what a dream!'

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As secretary of the Friends of the Environment club, write a speech you would give to the students of your school on the need to keep the environment clean.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to the Member of Parliament of your constituency, telling him/her about the rise in armed robbery in your area. Suggest at least two ways to check it.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story which ends with the sentence: We arrived just in time to save the situation.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your father has received the 'National Best Farmer's Award'. Write a letter to your brother who is outside the country, describing the ceremony.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your friend telling him or her three ways in which the computer has made learning easier for students.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in a national newspaper discussing at least two reasons why students should cultivate the habit of reading.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Describe one national event that took place recently and state at least two effects it had on the people in your area.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You have been offered admission to a Senior High School to pursue a programme which you do not like. Write a letter to the headmaster of the school stating at least two reasons why you want the programme changed.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article to be published in a national newspaper on why every school should have a library.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write the speech you would give at your school's graduation day on The school's achievements and failures in the academic year.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to the Presiding Member of your district assembly telling him or her about two of the achievements of your community over the last five years and the plans for the future.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your friend has informed you that his or her uncle has decided not to look after him or her in school anymore. Write to your friend's uncle giving him at least, two reasons why he should change his mind.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write arguments for or against the topic: It is more advantageous to live in the village than in the city.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your friend describing how you saved a child who was in danger.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in your school magazine on the topic; The relationship between parents and their children should be cordial.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a story which ends with the sentence, We were lucky that night.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: You have been installed a chief in your hometown. Write a letter to your friend in another school telling him or her, at least, two things you intend doing to develop the town.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in one of the national newspapers on the topic: The usefulness of the mobile phone.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Write a story that ends with the expression: So it pays to be kind to strangers.

 

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As a School Prefect, write a letter to your District or Municipal or Metropolitan Chief Executive requesting the maintenance of the building in your school.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write arguments for or against the topic: Life in the city is more dangerous than that in the village.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Write a report to the Headteacher of your school about how a senior girl beat up a junior boy.

  

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to your headmaster discussing two games that should be encouraged among the students in your school.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in your school magazine on why every student should be computer-literate.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Write an interesting story which ends with the words, It pays to be kind to strangers.

 

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for the publication in a national newspaper on the topic, The harmful effects of examination malpractice.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As the senior prefect of your school, write a letter to the headmaster, discussing two reasons why, the school should instill moral values into the students.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Writ a speech you should give to the people in your community on how to keep the environment clean.

 

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to the Ministry of Transport suggesting two ways of improving the public transport road system in the country.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: As the main speaker in a debate on the motion, Students should not wear uniform to school, write your speech for or against the motion.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Write a letter to invite your cousin to spend the holidays with your grandparents, giving two reasons why he/she should pay them a visit.

 

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an article for publication in your school magazine on the topic, My Role Model and how he/she has Influenced me.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write an interesting story that ends with the expression, Unfortunately I realized when it was too late that my friend was a wolf in sheep's clothing.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Write a letter to your friend describing two ways in which you prepared for your father's birthday party and tell him/her what made the party a memorable one.

 

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Write a letter to the Director of Health of your district, discussing two ways in which the activities of some food sellers affect the health of people in your community and suggest one solution to the problem.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Narrate an interesting story that ends with the statement, Indeed, it was a great achievement.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
Write an article for publication in a national newspaper on two effects of poor disposal of waste on the people and suggest two ways of solving the problem.

  

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your friend who lives in another town thinks that school life is boring and wants to leave school to start petty trading. Write a letter to encourage him/her to remain in school. In the letter, discuss two aspects of school life that you find enjoyable.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: A teacher from your school won the first prize as the National Best Teacher. You were selected to represent your school at the ceremony. Write a report on what you saw and discuss two lessons you learned as you observed the event.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
It is an election year and the major political parties have started campaigning. As a peace-loving member of your community, write an article for publication in a local newspaper of the community, discussing two ways of maintaining peace during the period.

  

PART BCOMPREHENSION[30 marks]

Read the following passage carefully and answer all the questions which follow.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: Your composition should be about 250 words long.
questions.paperInstructions:
hour

This paper consists of three parts: A, B and C.

Answer three questions in all; one question from Part A and all the questions in Part B and Part C.

Answer all questions in your answer booklet.

Credit will be given for clarity of expression and orderly presentation of material

PART A

WRITING

[30 marks]

Answer one question only from this part.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText: The government has announced the addition of new public holidays. Write an article to be published in a national newspaper on two effects of public holidays on teaching and learning.

questions.subject: english
questions.questionText:
You once doubted your abilities, but an experience changed your mindset completely. Write your story, ending with the statement, "I will never compare myself with anyone again."

 

PART B

READING

[20 marks]
